website_summaries.verdict: The best step machine on the market. An agreeable price tag and versatile design appeals to a wide range of customers.
pros: Separates itself from the rest of the pack due to its highly ergonomic design
Adjustable height settings suit all body types
cons: The foot pedals are smaller than those of most other units

website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy machine that targets a variety of muscle groups for an excellent workout.
pros: With its solid design, this machine stands out for its durability and can work for people of most weights
Users also appreciate that is it quiet and works for a variety of different fitness levels
cons: The assembly can be a bit more difficult than some of the other machines on the market, and the lack of tension settings make it less versatile than some other models

website_summaries.verdict: A popular choice if you are looking for an effective total body work out.
pros: Users appreciate the excellent workout they get with this machine and that it targets all the muscle groups despite its streamlined design
We love that is is also solidly constructed, quiet, and easy to assemble
cons: Some users experienced paint chipping off over time, and a few reported experiencing knee pain after use
Those looking for a more low-impact machine might consider the Gazelle Supreme

customer_reviews.title: Failed in 17 Days with Regular Use
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product is poor; it has begun to fail after 17 days of moderate use. It only survived 17K steps and 2.5K calories (less than 1 pound) of use. The plastic rollers cannot handle the friction of normal use. See the attached photo and the log which shows all use from Day 1. I weigh 185 pounds, well below the weight limit, and I averaged less than 20 minutes a day. $200 for 17 days is $4294 annually; a professional-grade machine will cost half of that and endure years of punishment. If you value your money, spend it on something else.
customer_reviews.author: Elo

customer_reviews.title: Simple, steady and works
customer_reviews.text: Im 6'3" 225lb and this thing is stable and gives a great cardio work out, push with the legs then pull more with arms then reverse grip. I feel it in bi's, tri's, lats, gluts, and legs are on fire. No knee problems i do 15 min am and 15 min pm.
customer_reviews.author: Scuba Steve

customer_reviews.title: When you use this machine you get really good results
customer_reviews.text: I like to use this Maxi Climber. I notice a big difference in my arms, legs and my glutes. I noticed they are a little more defined. And I only do about 5 to 10 minutes everyday including weekends. This was a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Rosado

customer_reviews.title: Don't underestimate it!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the hardest workout machines I've used. It looked so simple and it fits the space in my apartment perfectly. I thought I could spend 20min a day on it no problem, however I'm working on going a minute straight. It kills my legs but in a good way! 💪🏻
customer_reviews.author: Andrea White

customer_reviews.title: The rollers start pealing off preventing it from going up and down
customer_reviews.text: After having this product for 5 weeks it was working great however today while using it for a bit it did not roll up or down anymore. The rollers started pealing off and prevented them from rolling. Unfortunately since we only get 30 days to return it Can’t be replaced. Very diappointed because I was really getting used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe Jorge

customer_reviews.title: It's a shame...
customer_reviews.text: I actually don't hate the workout, I like it....but...I have only used this for ~1500 steps and was really shocked to find that there is already a wheel inside that is on it's way out and right pedal is wobbling like crazy. And I don't slam the pedals all the way down, so that is not the problem. This is a huge disappointment as I was planning to use this a lot this winter, plus of course $$ wasted.
customer_reviews.author: TMBasford

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to try this machine. I work out at least five days per week and am in decent shape. After the first use my knees hurt very badly. The foot holders should have some type of hydraulic shocks to help absorb the impact as you lower your feet. Also if you are taller than 5' 7'' you are too tall for this machine. I wish I could return it. Should have spent the extra money on a rower. #disappointed
customer_reviews.author: tamara

customer_reviews.title: i'm a regular 4-mile walker so i figured 10 minutes ...
customer_reviews.text: i'm a regular 4-mile walker so i figured 10 minutes would be a decent first work out. I COULD NOT WALK FOR 3 DAYS! this machine will whoop your fanny!
customer_reviews.author: K. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: The features is good, the quality is bad!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriend on June 2nd 2017, she loved it. But the right pad was broken on June 20th 2017, see the photos .The quality is not as good as we expected! She had exercised for 16 days and 30 minutes per day, costed calories around 400 per time. she is around 100 pounds. To the lower quality, I don't think it's worth $199 plus tax. We are going to return it and looking for a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect it to last!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Maxi Climber for 15 minutes every other day for 3 months. It gives a good workout, but the quality is horrible!!! After every workout there is fragments of plastic & now metal on the ground. It's very rough, almost completely destroyed. Update... it seized completely up. Bought another brand that seems to work better... well see how it goes. Not sure why they can't build higher quality? I would easily pay $500.00 if it were built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Lewis

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER MONTH AND A HALF!!
customer_reviews.text: After using this product for about a month and a half one of the plastic rolling wheels that are under the pedals/handles (3 on each side for a total of 6) started to wear off and plastic pieces started to fall out. The machine is no longer smooth it is a very bumpy ride and uncomfortable to use. I use it 4 to 5 times a week for 30 minutes, if you use it less it may last longer. I really like this machine and I wish it was built to last longer than a month and a half.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: BEST.  THING.  EVER.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this is by far the best workout I've ever had, either at the gym or at home. They have discovered the absolute simplest possible machine to deliver the absolute maximum full-body workout. Forget biking, forget stationary bikes, forget Stairmaster, forget Pilates, forget rowing machines. You will burn more calories per given time on the Maxi-Climber than anything else. It takes a little getting used to, because it makes big use of the hamstrings, but once you acclimate them to the workout, you'll feel more vigorous after doing the Maxi-Climber than anything else. Plus, it's cheap, it's simple to put together, it's sturdy (I weigh 170 lbs) and it doesn't take up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tangredi

customer_reviews.title: I should have listened to the bad reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 11 weeks, 4 to 5 times a week and it is now unusable. As all the bad reviews said, the rollers are plastic and are chipping and wearing down. I am so unbelievably disappointed. This is such a great workout and I would have paid more for the machine if they made it with parts that last. Shame on the Maxi Climber company for making such an inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: FAB504

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews. I did, but I didn’t listen...
customer_reviews.text: This thing broke after two months of light use. I weigh 130, so I didn’t break it. I loved it while it worked. I purchased the extended warranty. I called them when it broke. They gave me all this information to fill out, told me to take a video and send it to them. I did all of that and never heard back from them. Now, every time I call, I either get an answering machine that is not in English or a person answers who barely speaks English. I am extremely dissatisfied, and I should have listened to the reviews. Buyer beware. It will break, and nothing will be done about it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Morgan

customer_reviews.title: It’s amazing! I’m 52
customer_reviews.text: Surprise! It’s amazing! I’m 52, out of shape with high blood pressure. When I got this, it was a last, desperate attempt to find something that I would do and would achieve results. A week ago, it kicked my ass at 2 minutes. Two minutes I can fit into my morning and evening routines. After ONE WEEK I am now definitely feeling and seeing a difference - all over. My upper arms are changing, my legs (calves and thighs) are different, upper belly fat is less and, yes, even the back fat is lessened. Today I moved to 2m 30secs! Last week I was gasping and envisioning biggest loser coaches hollering at me to dig deep! Get this one!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality junk, potentially unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Product is easy to move good range of motion and assemble. These are all true. However this is a cheap made poor lay designed and now disposed of piece of junk, despite getting multiple replacement parts and even a replacement climber! It is jus poor quality and not robust for any serious user. I had the counter intermittent then finally break twice. Foot rest snap off and the actual frame snap, all whilst being used. It just broke once more on the replacement unit so I am done. It is going in the trash and I will next time spend the money on quality
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Quite a Workout!
customer_reviews.text: The climber gives quite a workout on the abdominal and lower body. Go slow first and pace your workout, otherwise you'll tire quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw, friction from pedals heats up the unit and causes odors
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the unit until I started noticing more friction from the pedal units. Turns out, the design causes rubber and metal to rub against the metal rails that stand the unit up. This causes heat and the smell of rubber and metal grinding down. The metal rails get hot within a few minutes and it's unbearable. Fatal flaw.
customer_reviews.author: D.K.

customer_reviews.title: We liked the look of the Maxi Climber on the internet ...
customer_reviews.text: We liked the look of the Maxi Climber on the internet but when it arrived and we put it together, we wondered if two 70 plus old timers like us could really get on it. But we love it now! I hold it steady for my 78 year old husband and he climbs like a pro. He holds it for me and I move slower but we both like the way it uses our whole bodies. This was a great purchase and it doesn't take up too much room!
customer_reviews.author: A Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excited to add this to my routine
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my home gym. Very happy with purchase. Easy to assemble in under 10mins! Great product. Update: Soooo embarassing. I used this for no more than 5 mins yesterday and am crazy sore, I rarely get sore when I work out. I did use it for 5 mins, before my squat row machine. I am impressed. Wish the arms didn't make a mild grinding noise, probably would have gone longer. Thinking some lithium grease on the handles may help. Will let you guys know if it works.
customer_reviews.author: M. Galindo

customer_reviews.title: Plastic rollers get too hot and fall apart
customer_reviews.text: I’m on my third replacement and have to return again. Rollers disintegrated after about 10-20,000 steps which was around a month or so of use. The company has to know they should use a heat resistant product but they don’t. Friction of use causes rollers to rip up causing a bumpy feeling that’s intolerable as you climb. I just want my money back at this point because it’s s total pain taking apart, returning and putting three climbers together in six months time.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Inefficient design, wears out too quick, and lousy customer support
customer_reviews.text: Step counter/timer is positioned at your crotch and can't be viewed while using the stepper (must get off to read it); also if you lean back at all, it wants to tip over. My rollers crumbled apart in less than 6 months of use. Company offered to replace rollers under warranty, but it's been over a month so far and still no parts shipped out. That's a month-long disruption of my workout routine. I'm giving up and throwing this junk in the garbage where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’ll kick your butt! (In a good way)!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic! Easy to assemble and very sturdy. Was concerned about having my toddler around it but you can’t knock the thing over! I have a gym membership but wanted a machine at home that the gym doesn’t have. This is perfect for anyone that enjoys a vigorous workout. You will literally sweat your butt off! The machine won’t cheat for you it’s all you! You will cuss this thing out every time you get on it!
customer_reviews.author: charles dennison

customer_reviews.title: great space saving but needs better quality parts
customer_reviews.text: Excited to get this climber/stepper. Directions were clear and assembled very easily. Only nit would be the pulley wheel and step slider wheels are plastic so I'm a little apprehensive about the wear. I'll think i'll probably try pre-buy these parts just in case they wear quickly or break. Update - I've been using this for a week now and i thought people should realize if you have bad knees this will make them hurt more. My knees are prone to soreness so i have to be careful with this. Also i think that MaxiClimber cut some corners with quality. I certainly would have paid a little more for metal pulley wheel, chain, and slider wheels.
customer_reviews.author: RavenGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Climber
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for losing weight and toning. I have lost 73 pounds so far in the past six months using the climber 160-200 minutes a week, along with a balanced, low calorie diet. I have also gained a lot of nice lean muscle mass, which is an excellent bonus. One downside is that the climber needs to be lubricated often in order to keep it running smoothly. I sweat all over it though, so it's to be expected. Overall I'm extremely satisfied with the climber. I'm a much happier person than I used to be. If you're overweight and ready to make a change, try it. Don't be intimidated, start out slow. You can do it!
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo952

customer_reviews.title: Intense Workout
customer_reviews.text: The Maxi climber is a super hard workout. I will be so happy when I can get up to 5 minutes without stopping. It is the best workout equipment I have purchased thus far. It's worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Renee M.

customer_reviews.title: Great workout!
customer_reviews.text: What a workout. Definitely see major improvement within a month's time. It's hard people, I couldn't even last three minutes at first but don't give up stick with it. The hardest things in life are the most rewarding.
customer_reviews.author: William DiMarie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to my home gym
customer_reviews.text: This is the best exercise buy ever for a home gym. I’ve had it for a while now and thought it was time to spread the word of its benefits. It was easy to set up. It’s light and easy to move around, while being very sturdy. And it takes up very little space. From a workout perspective it’s great too! You can work as hard as you want by increasing your range of motion, and let’s face it - climbing will definitely get your heart pumping. It’s also low impact, so my knees don’t hurt afterward. From my point of view, it’s an economical must-have for your home gym!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Did not last 6 months of 3days per week of 20 min workout. Quality issues. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December 2018 and it’s unusable now in June 2019 due to cheap parts and quality. I used it 20 mins , 3-4 times a week. Poor quality and build. I would look elsewhere if you use it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: travelguy

customer_reviews.title: It's a good workout but the whole product is made very poorly
customer_reviews.text: I'm probably being a little harsh but I"m not going to change my grade. It's a good workout but the whole product is made very poorly. It feels like it's about to break apart whenever I use it. I can hear it cracking. It's also very loud. I live in an apartment and I don't like using it because I know I'm disturbing my neighbors. Yes, it's that loud. I would not recommend this as your sole source for cardio. Extended daily workouts with the maxi climber will cause this flimsy machine to break apart. I would recommend using it as one station for a cross circuit workout.
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Big time heart pumping workout!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy well built machine. Very easy setup and take down for convenient storage. I found the Maxi Climber to be a great workout, with that serious heart pumping motion.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quick to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy and quick to assemble. Stable for me (6'2 and 185). I run and mountain bike, so looking for something to mix into other days. The comments about "no resistance" are too funny. This is by design and if the people writing the comments tried to workout for more than 1 minute, they would have realized it immediately. If you are not in decent shape when starting, try 2 or 3 sets with 3 minutes each at a fluid pace.
customer_reviews.author: Deet

customer_reviews.title: I can last a half hour doing cardio n I'm good. But this machine
customer_reviews.text: I have to say..this machine makes me feel really out of shape. Unless I'm truly am lol. I can last a half hour doing cardio n I'm good. But this machine, I can only last up to 2 full mins n I'm done. I'm 5"6 and I weight 165 n 33yrs old. Don't know if that helps but I have to say this machine will give you a really good cardio work out..
customer_reviews.author: claribel

customer_reviews.title: Not a 'As seen on TV piece of shinola, it will kick your katookas and make you sore. (Very effective machine)
customer_reviews.text: My wife asked for this. I have bad knees and trying it was painful for me. My wife on the other hand loves it. This is not a fad machine, it's real equipment. It's also hard. :-) If you are willing to put the effort into it, It will wear you out fast. Like the Listerine commercial says 'You can tell its working by the burn.' M<y wife has sore legs ever since she got it. Set up was straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: bdmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer for "Fit" people
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the reviews, and generally, people mentioned that it was the best total body work out. I have not doubt that it is, but I am out of shape, and it is such a difficult workout that I can only do it for 2 or 3 minutes, not long enough to get anything out of it. Just like anything, I am sure that if I keep at it, I will be able to last longer. My other issue with this is that it is hard on my knees. I am in my late 40's, and my knees pop going down stairs, and this exercise makes my knees hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Maiko N.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous broken pedal already?!?
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a zero star if I could. I’m posting this review so others can stay away from this poorly made product that is $200!?!?. I received it today and one of the pedals didn’t even hold together during shipping. The metal part that’s supposed to be welded together is completely separated. If the pedal can be separated during shipping, I wouldn’t even consider going on this. Now I have to figure out how I’m going to haul this heavy thing to the UPS store to get the refund during this time, which is a huge inconvenience and can be unsafe. This is not worth taking the risk.
customer_reviews.author: ZK

customer_reviews.title: 10 minutes seems like a short time
customer_reviews.text: I am actually very impressed with the workout you get from this thing and the results. Just ten minutes 5 times a week for a couple months now and I am actually noticing my stamina is really improving and I am noticing more definition on my arms and legs. I also noticing that the fat deposits I had on my legs are going away. I have used literally dozens of types of workout equipment from the gazelle to jogger trampolines to elipticals and I have not seen such results from such a short workout. Trust me, 10 minutes seems like a short time, but at the beginning I had difficulty doing 2 minutes on this thing without having to stop.
customer_reviews.author: TeePanic

customer_reviews.title: Not for long term
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine because it seems convenient with small space. After 7 months of use, some parts of the machine starting wearing down. I really liked the machine, but now I barely use it because it makes a lot of noise when you climb up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Francis T.

customer_reviews.title: Rethink this
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't feel natural. You can hurt your knees easily or your spine and shoulders. This will become one of those things you never use, is not worth the use compared to other more affordable exercises much less than $150 and safer for your body. After several months I regret this!
customer_reviews.author: Aliasa

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking at this for a while and finally decided to purchase. It is very easy to assemble. I assembled by myself in 15 min. This is the perfect equipment for the novice. However I gave 4 stars because I'm atheletic and it couldn't match up to my rower or stairclimber If you are like me and workout at least an hour a day already (cardio and power weight lifting), you won't find this equipment very challenging. There is no way to increase resistance so there it isn't the greatest for the more experienced. I will like resell since my other cardio machines do a much better job at getting my heart rate up.
customer_reviews.author: nubonics

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase more than a year later!!!
customer_reviews.text: After more than a year. Works great, super easy to to setup, I use on carpet, almost too easy to collapse flat against wall and slide back out makes the work out really convenient. Lite weight, may not be for the (BEAST at the GYM) But for home use with two Users three times a week ~ no issues. The only issue I have is the Timer, badly positioned, purchased a separate small timer which works great. Personal issue.
customer_reviews.author: cindy boos

customer_reviews.title: Tougher than it looks
customer_reviews.text: This is so difficult to use! Do not recommend for someone just starting out trying to get in shape. It does work; however, as the first time I tried it could only use for about 30 seconds and was sore the next day. I'm not ridiculously out of shape, I bike ride, but this is no comparison. If you're looking for something you can use to sustain a cardiovascular workout as you're just getting started, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: G L

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product,,you will feel muscles you forgot you use. hahahahaha....your first two weeks are the hardiest but don't give up,,,keep working out those sore muscles,,, I have a neck and back injury so I got my doctors permission first before buying it.. I strongly recommend this... this is great for beginners' who are just starting to workout..go slow,, and becareful with any workout equipment and do stretches. I always stretch before any workout and drink my 16 oz. of water before working out to stay hydrated...I drink an hour before workouts... please try this product its great..
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for a bit yet a couole if days ago the paint started coming off the metal grinding together when i raise up n it keeps scratching the paint..and making a loud noise. I am disappointed with the quality...
customer_reviews.author: Zaimary

customer_reviews.title: Tough Love
customer_reviews.text: After suffering accidents/injuries to both my neck and knee, it was a struggle to find a form of strenuous exercise that would limit further damage to those joints. However, I'm happy to report at long last I have found it.This climber was quite challenging at first and I had to build strength back up in my legs to begin to use it at length. Now that I have I am able to get a great workout in. I have greatly improved cardiovascular endurance and strength in my legs. While this is billed as a full body workout, I don't feel my upper body gets near as much exertion but I just supplement with some free weights and I'm good.
customer_reviews.author: Regan

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend to use a ratchet set to tighten the bolts ...
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived early and very welll packed. I would recommend to use a ratchet set to tighten the bolts instead of the wrench that is included . I love the way it folds down to be stored out of the way. I’m 5’3 and under 140 pounds and it seems to be perfect for my height/weight . Solid product .
customer_reviews.author: Lori Ann

customer_reviews.title: Amazing machine with amazing results!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing machine! My husband purchased it as an overall cardio workout and I fell “in love” with it. After having it for 2 months, it is definitely a favorite workout for me. I have lost 6 pounds and inches off my waist. I have not changed my eating habits but incorporated the workout almost daily. It is very easy to use and definitely gets you into shape! Honestly can’t say enough good things about it and the results it gives you. If you’re thinking of purchasing it, do it!! It is definitely worth it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The one on the right is fine but for some reason the one on the left ...
customer_reviews.text: The roller sheared off with one month of use. There is a roller on each leg that runs up and down the bottom bar one on each side. The one on the right is fine but for some reason the one on the left has worn down and now it’s metal on metal. I weigh just under 200 lbs and with a steady use (twice a week for 30 min each day) the equipment failed on me. Not sure what to do next.....
customer_reviews.author: Knish

customer_reviews.title: it does so if you are a fitness buff this is the machine for you it will definitely definitely give you a great work out
customer_reviews.text: I am too lazy and I have only tried the machine a couple of times but when I tell you that it works out your entire body and puts your heart rate through the roof, it does so if you are a fitness buff this is the machine for you it will definitely definitely give you a great work out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: i love the maxi clinber
customer_reviews.text: i've had my climber for a year now. i love it. it is a great workout when used with other equipment. admittedly, this is not a versaclimber. but then, you arent paying versaclimber prices. for those that complain about falling over backwards, i have some advice for ya...don't lean back. i've never had the "falling over backwards" fear and i've been working out on this piece of gear for a year. love it!
customer_reviews.author: James T. McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Quality of product
customer_reviews.text: This machine is great delivered on time but noticed the box was damaged on one side. When assembling noticed a leg would not fit, one of the foot attachments was dented. A result of the handling from delivery company. I did manage to fix with pliers and a little elbow grease. Also a small black plastic piece was found in the box which could be from the counter section, I did not find anything broken on the outer area but it could be from within where the battery is located. Other than that the rest of the machine works great.my wife and I love it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This work well. I like that you can place your hands in 3 different positions. It really looks your legs and but. I do this while watching Netflix at home. I do wish I could change the tension. Once you get used to it it doesn’t really give as good of a workout. So I do want you to be aware of that. I would recommend if you’re new to working out or if you have multiple pieces of cardio equipment so you can switch it up as not to get bored.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only 6000 steps in and plastic rolling wheel broken
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a few months. The plastic wheel that rolls along the frame has shredded apart and will not roll smoothly. Feels like it gets too hot for these plastic parts. Trying to reach out and see if they will do anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rollers fall apart
customer_reviews.text: The rollers on this product are not designed to handle excessive use. They are made of a material that seems like hard plastic and they don’t spin consistently. When they stop spinning the friction between the metal on the maxi climber and the roller flattens out the round surface. Over time the roller begins to fall apart and chunks of plastic fall to the ground. If you call maxi climber they charge you a one time fee around $30 for replacement parts. I’ve already ordered 3 boxes of 6 rollers. These machines need a lot of lube or grease just to get a month of use. Great concept. Great workout when they work. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for consistent use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year and it finally broke on me. Like a lot of reviews, the plastic wheel seemed to "shred" off, making the machine effectively useless. I used it on and off and it honestly wasn't until this past January that it finally failed me since I was using it at least 3 times a week. It's a real bummer because I was really seeing a change in my body and losing weight. I think I will look into ordering a new one with a better design. The concept is fantastic but the plastic wheel needs to be improved. I don't want to buy a new machine every year or even after consistent use.
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the MaxiClimber for two days. I assembled it by myself (mid 50's out of shape female) in about 15 minutes. The assembly directions are exceptionally well written, down to telling you where to find each bolt, nut and washer. Basically you attach the feet, the cable, and the handles. This machine is challenging for me, and will be a great addition to my walking only exercise routine. It uses only one's body weight as resistance, so may not be for the established athlete. I will update the review in a couple months on how it is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Wore down within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Loved this until it stopped working smoothly. With two months of use, plastic around the pedal mechanism wore down and now the range of motion is no longer smooth. Feels very rough, and makes a lot of noise now when I use it. Will most likely take to goodwill as I’m past the return window. Note, I did mount as directed, so I don’t think this is from user error. It just wears down with use. Was very easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria F.

customer_reviews.title: Worried of how sturdy it will actually be
customer_reviews.text: It’s super easy to assemble. I’m a girl with almost no tools and loved the fact that it came with the needed wrench. Only thing that worries me is how flimsy it seems. I may be wrong but we’ll see I guess. The safety clip on the bottom is pretty easy to remove so I’m also worried that it may wiggle its way off during a workout. It’s a tall machine but fits fine. Very compact.
customer_reviews.author: A compulsive shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good workout!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Two things to keep in mind: because it has no assistance whatsoever it’s hard on beginners and out of shape people such as myself, but I believe in time it will get easier. Also, you will HAVE TO anchor this thing down somehow, otherwise you will always feel like you’re about to tip backwards. Personally, I tuck the front legs under the side of my couch and that works for me. Other than that, great piece of equipment for a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Camille V.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the bomb. Easy to put together, takes up little room, and powerful workout. I do squats holding weights most days, but 4 rounds of 2 minutes each on the first day had my legs aching the next day! I thought it would feel flimsy and wobbly, but it is solid. Will update if it starts falling apart too soon. I'm concerned about the pedals from what others have written. I'd rather have a $2000 elliptical of course, but this will do fine for the price and small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Total Body Workout, Compact “Machine”
customer_reviews.text: What a workout! I couldn’t understand why a lot of the reviewers talked about only 5 or 10 mins on the climber, now I know why. I push myself to 10 mins when I use it and slowly going over the 10, but it is tough. Definitely a full body workout in a compact “machine”. It fits pretty much anywhere, and can fold up to fit in a closet if needed. You learn quickly not to lean back on it- it will tip- but bedsides that it is a sturdy piece of equipment. I’m 5’9” 145lbs and my husband is 6’1” 210lbs and it works well for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: This is my second review
customer_reviews.text: The Maxi Climber is a good exerciser ( I have had for about 3months now), however in the last couple of weeks I have to continually spray the belt with WD-40 because it squeaks and screeches that is very irritating while working out. I have to spray a couple of times a week, then I have to smell WD-40 while working our...not good
customer_reviews.author: Gregory miller

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a month and then began to fall apart. The handles used to glide smoothly up and down and progressively got rougher and rougher. It eventually got to the point where plastic began to slough off and it is unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Maxiclimber
customer_reviews.text: Real deal as far as I’m concerned, Advid hiker and mountain biker , this gives me a solid full body core workout. Light weight, easy to use and set up, quiet, no motors , nothing extra. Perfect for those rainy or cold snowy days you just want to stay inside and get a solid quick workout 🏋️‍♀️ in .
customer_reviews.author: M.Denly

customer_reviews.title: Causes me knee pain when I used it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was easy to put together and looks like it would do the great job, but unfortunately after just a few minutes my knees really started hurting and feeling weird below the kneecap. I have never had knee problems in the past and I don't want to start now so I am not going to take any chances and continue using it. It's literally been a couple weeks later and both knees still have aching from time to time. Definitely going to try and sell it on Craigslist. If you can use it without knee pain I think it would be a great cardio machine, but you won't know until you try it out for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: luckyguy73

customer_reviews.title: Good posture needed or you'll tip over
customer_reviews.text: Good quality...for price. Works as intended and I do get a good workout burn from it...I keep mine on carpet and when using I have to make sure I'm seeing correct posture. If I lean forward too much you can feel It to start tipping. I haven't tipped over yet but close when I first started. Probably better on a hard surface. I'm 6'2 and 185lbs. Plenty of clearance from fir me from a normal ceiling height.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great workout
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical having never used a climber, but this really provides a great workout. The motion hits a lot of muscles from entire lower body, to core, to arms and shoulders. The app is also well done. I've only done 4 exercises, so I'm sure at some point I will hit my free limit and will need to start paying for the app workouts. But the workouts do a great job in varying the movements and tempo as well as keeps you from allowing yourself from being lazy. Because of the variety of movement (long steps vs short & three different gripping options) I would recommend this workout over others with just single movement (bikes, rowing, elliptical)
customer_reviews.author: Jared Malapit

customer_reviews.title: I didn't feel much of a workout to me it felt like walking, I even use a heart rate monitor ...
customer_reviews.text: The movement does seem to target the muscle mentioned, but I wish the machine had more of a resistance band or a way to increase the force. I'm returning mines,I didn't feel much of a workout to me it felt like walking, I even use a heart rate monitor to measure my heart heart to see how much aerobic activity, (I used the fit band) my heart rate stayed within the range that I usually achieve with walking. I'm not even in shape (5'5 180 gal). I no longer want to keep it. Maybe I'll buy a elliptical where I can change the resistance instead and get a more intense workout.
customer_reviews.author: purplerose

customer_reviews.title: Came in damaged
customer_reviews.text: I may have to return it and receive a new one because one of the parts is damaged. I can get the safety pin about halfway in but I can’t get it through the last hole because the part is sticking out sideways too much. UPDATE: I moved/shook the machine around and it seems pretty stable even with the safety pin not in all the way so I’m going to finish assembling it and attempt to use it as is. I definitely don’t think it’s worth the $150 I paid especially since it game damaged but oh well. I just have to be super careful using it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: I've always been leary of "as seen on tv" products but this exceeded my expectations. Really works full legs, butt and stomach more than expected for such a lightweight inexpensive product. Doesn't take up much room is a big bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: How easy it is to assemble and how quiet it is when being used.
customer_reviews.text: It has been a while since I bought this exercise machine. But I have to say it's been worth every penny. It's easy to assemble, it occupies very little space and best of all it works! It firms up my legs and waist and arms. My legs and buttocks are toned and very firm and strong. I love this maxi-climber. This is the only exercise machine I've kept. All the others I donated due to loss of interest. But this is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Graham

customer_reviews.title: ass kicker
customer_reviews.text: But, I really like it. The ultimate isometric workout. Build up tolerance but I love the full body workout when I use my arms too. Be careful to protect your foot arches. Use solid shoes and be sure you don't overstretch your arch by using on your toes. I tend to put my feet mid-foot or almost toward my heels so i don't fatigue my feet plantar facia.. Be careful but if you can make it work, it's fantastic. Build your upper body before you try arms, or again, go slow and work up...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for the first 1000 climbs
customer_reviews.text: The product works. However after 1100 “climbs” with it the rollers that go up and down are grinding away. There is a vibration every time I go up and down. Visual there is debris coming from the roller.
customer_reviews.author: Jway_369

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This machine was great up until it broke. And when it breaks it breaks conveniently after the refund window. And don't even bother try to talk to customer service. I called maxi climber they told me to call Amazon and then Amazon told me to call maxi climber. Now maxi climber customer service just hung up on me and is not picking up my calls. Do yourself a favor and just get a gym membership
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Like many other users, I've used it a couple times a week for six months. The inner guide wheels wear out quickly and it no longer works. I've contacted the company to see if I can get the wheels replaced.
customer_reviews.author: The Anderson

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY! my home gym arrive
customer_reviews.text: Finally!, This been on my wishlist since December '17... It took exactly 20 min to put together. Make sure u put an ankle weight or sandbag on back of legs to keep sturdy. I'm finding that when working out YOU MUST STAND ERECT AND LEAN TOWARDS THE MACHINE, or it will tilt backwards. That's why it works your core muscles by having you to stand correct posture and workout.
customer_reviews.author: paul retired military

customer_reviews.title: good maching bad costermer sevice
customer_reviews.text: missing parts and i discribe what im missing never got the screws and told them i need the base screws n wrench an ontil today nothing even got pics
customer_reviews.author: malove

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a short workout
customer_reviews.text: As pictured, basically easy to assemble if assembling items is something you don’t mind doing . I wish it had different levels of Intensity and difficulty to make the workout more difficult and add variety. It does make your legs burn but more just the triceps and does nothing for the arms or back, and very little workout for the quadriceps or glutes...a little disappointed. 30 minutes is enough because the front of your legs are on fire and then you get super bored.
customer_reviews.author: MEM

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with a cracked center "console". Disappointing, but it doesn't keep the device from working. I've tried it and was initially surprised by lack of resistance provided to my legs. Further experimentation suggests that the leg or arm resistance is controlled by the amount of "hanging" you do with your hands/arms. My next climber will probably have a resistance control. My initial reaction is that it's worth the money. (But it wouldn't hurt for it to arrive intact.)
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: This is what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I like this for a overall good exercise. I can easily last on it for a good 45 minute workout, and be soaked with sweat without being completely exhausted after words. This is good for my whole body. So natural of a workout. I feel good results. I believe it is well built. I don't like the timer on it. It don't work well, but not a big deal, I use a stop watch. This is worth every penne regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Morse

customer_reviews.title: More than expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm 290lbs. I was a bit hesitant in purchasing this as I wasn't sure it would hold my weight. It has worked out great. My normal weight is 245lbs, so I'm using this to lose weight. Very easy to assemble. Others have commented that you shouldn't use this if you are over weight, well I have to disagree. Workout is based on your body weight.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert A. Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Great Overall Workout When You Can’t Make It To the Gym
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy piece of equipment. Both my 250lb husband and my less than 250lb frame can comfortably use this. It has a multifunctional counter that shows calories burned.. number of steps and time on machine. You get an overall leg and upper body workout. I feel it more in my quads. I’ve noticed my back is slimmer and arms are toning up. No Cons.. all Pros. It doesn’t take up much space either!
customer_reviews.author: Sobossy

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to assemble but difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Maxi-Climber for about 3 months. I bought it primarily to help lose weight and tighten my abs and core. It seems to work well on lower body strength, thigh and leg muscles, but has not helped much with upper body and arm strength. At 6'4" tall and weighing 226 pounds, I should easily be able to do 20 - 30 workouts on the machine, necessary to get heart rate up for a good cardio workout. But I can't because my leg and thigh muscles start screaming "STOP" after 4 minutes or so. So what can I do to make exercise easier and target the upper body area. Any ideas, anyone?
customer_reviews.author: Alan Dupureur

customer_reviews.title: Design flaws, needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after a friend recommended I add it to my workout routine. I already spin 5 times a week and run on the weekends, but I wanted to beef up my workout. I really wanted to love this climber, but unfortunately, I don't. For starters, it is very flimsy. Like other reviewers say, it feels like you might tip over on it. Second, the pedals on the climber are very uncomfortable. No matter what shoes I wear, the pedals really hurt my feet. The middle section (where the display is) is awkward, and my knees often bang in to it. Overall, not great for working out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I suspect I received a unit from a previously opened box.
customer_reviews.text: I suspect I received a unit from a previously opened box. The battery is dead or the LCD is defective. I will have to invest in a new battery to see. There is also a long scratch on a metal bar. Haven't really tried it for extended exercise yet but I can tell using this will take a little practice. It was easy to assemble and has a small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: JSP

customer_reviews.title: BOTH wheels shot after 3 months. Boooo!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: WTF? I’ve used this thing 3 times a week for 2 months (which I loved), and all of the sudden it started become very hard to operate. I check the wheels - both are cracked. I’m a 5’10” male that weighs 185 lbs. totally not acceptable!!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with Maxiclimber
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived in an old torn and weathered box. It must have been sitting around for years. That explains why I was missing the safety pin, hand grips were torn and the monitor housing was broken. I also found the climber to be flimsy. I requested it returned the same day that I received it. I bought a Best Fitness BFMC10 Mountain Climber. The construction seems to be much sturdier (weights 2x as much). I've only had it for a week, so I have no idea if it will last any longer than the Maxiclimber. The functions are the same.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Yamabe

customer_reviews.title: Like how I feel but it's tough on the feet ...
customer_reviews.text: Like how I feel but it's tough on the feet / knees unless you are warmed up and have solid soles on...
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix7!

customer_reviews.title: Great extra work out
customer_reviews.text: Process a great work out in your home and takes up minimal space. I was surprised at how hard this was to do at first and had to build up to 30 minutes despite being able to do an hour on an elliptical with no problem. I love it for fitting in a workout when I don’t have time for the gym one day. My only complaints are that it is noisy and mine gives off black “dust” that is clearly some part being worn away. Not sure how long it will last but I have had for 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Best Buy of the year! This piece of equipment is getting my body back in shape. I keep it set up so I can get on any time. Still can’t make it to 10 min. I can only stay on for 5 min, about twice a day, But boy I’m feeling it. I have a problem knee from biking and was worried this excercise would hurt, but because the motion is the full range of motion, my knees are getting stronger. My back and abs are stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item and it was delivered broken with the box damaged. I returned it for a replacement which came in today and yet again this machine is BROKEN as well!! This is very disappointing and unacceptable. This product needs to be packed much better for transportation and delivery. Pictures are below. I had high hopes of using this product because of the good reviews but it's unfortunate that I can't even test it out. Poor quality product at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Workout
customer_reviews.text: We finally built a small gym in our house and the MaxiClimber is part of it. It’s fantastic, a great cardio workout, my husband who is retired military was disappointed at first because you couldn’t add weights or tension but he soon changed his mind! It’s a harder workout than it looks, it really works your body. We absolutely recommend it and it’s very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Doll K.

customer_reviews.title: Will Humble The Fit and Tune up the Unfit. Amazing Piece of Equipment
customer_reviews.text: The MaxiClimber is great but will give you a brutal workout if you try to do to much the first day. It is a total body workout. The equipment is stable but you must always make sure that you check the pin that holds the to bases together since it will dome out and leave the connector bar between the two bases in a position that might collapse. Other than that I love it and use it all the time for a quick workout. Remember it will kick your butt if you try to be macho and do to much at one time. Just work up to it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Received 2 Damaged Machines
customer_reviews.text: I am definitely concerned about the quality control in place for this machine. I received my first machine, put it together, and noticed it wasn't moving smoothly. I looked down and saw a broken piece of plastic from the roller that moves the pedals up and down. I contacted amazon, and a return was not a problem. A second machine arrives, and this time I knew where to check before I went through the process of putting it together. That machine was broken in the exact same place. Once again, thank you amazon for being awesome with returns. I like the idea of this machine, and seemed like it had potential.
customer_reviews.author: Hillmc719

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easily assembled, great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I researched which was the most well made vertical climber and decided on the Maxiclimber. I’m 119 lbs and 5’5”. For me, it feels sturdy. I believe it’s the best overall Exercise equipment because you can get a core body, glutes, upper body/arms and cardio, all in one machine. I was most surprised by how easily it was assembled.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: I thought what I bought was new.
customer_reviews.text: I thought what I bought was new. The seller was Amazon, and I thought what I was buying was suppose to be “new”. It came to me in just a cardboard box; not the Max box with the picture of the exercise equipment on it. It didn’t take me a long time to put it together; however, the timer did not work. I put a new battery in it, and now it works. So was this “really” new? I must say, that this MaxiClimber does give you a full body workout. I only gave it 4 stars because I had to put a new battery in it.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: “The Original” as in “Trash”
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, poor quality. See the other purchaser’s pictures and you will see where the unit will fail (the rollers and/or the connecting stand at the base of unit). Mine broke within 2 days of very light use & I have no intentions on getting a replacement. Manufacturer Customer support is non-existant, but Amazon is always good. These type of exercise units are great when they are made with the right kind of parts (not plastic), but those usually cost > $1k. The Amazon purchaser that made wooden foot supports for his MaxiClimber did a better quality job than the engineers for this.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Machine is sturdy, easy to put together and has a feature to adjust the sized based on the users height. I'm only 4'11 so this was a concern of mine, my 6' tall boyfriend is also able to use this machine comfortably without any issues. The app is useful and has some pretty cool recipes as well. The handle grips are very comfortable and foot pedals are studded so it's best to use wearing shoes. I love that it is compact and can easily fold up and be stored in the corner of my small townhome or in a storage closet.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: ... units in two months and while the workout is great, the machine starts to breakdown within one month
customer_reviews.text: Have gotten 2 units in two months and while the workout is great, the machine starts to breakdown within one month. 1st unit had a pedal issue that caused a subsequent scraping of the bars that made the machine unusable. Within one month of receiving the replacement unit it has presented the same pedal wear issue that is causing the 1st unit to shake and makes the strides difficult, shaky and frustrating. The machines were both used with care and within one month the issue is recurring so it seems as if this is due to a poor part in the pedal mechanism. I would give this item 5 stars if this issue did not continue to occur.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Rubber gliders wore out. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth buying. The rubber glides, near the foot pedals, began to wear quickly, becoming louder and leaving dust residue on my carpet. Looks like there's no solution, as I am not the only one with this exact issue.
customer_reviews.author: cofly79

product_meta.title: MaxiClimber(r) - The Original Patented Vertical Climber, As Seen On TV - Full Body Workout with Bonus Fitness App for iOS and Android
product_meta.description:
MaxiClimber is an easy-to-setup vertical climber that provides a full-body workout combining weight resistance, muscle toning and aerobic exercise all in the comfort of your home. MaxiClimber engages all major muscle groups to burn calories and build muscle. By using your own body weight as resistance, MaxiClimber gives a great cardio and strength training workout that’s low impact.

With the MaxiClimber Companion Fitness APP you get High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) routines that burn MAXIMUM calories in MINIMUM time, track your progress during the 21 Day Maxi-Challenge Program combined with a Meal Plan and 80+ recipes. Complete the 21 Day Maxi-Challenge to unlock 4 customized routines.Supports up to 240 pounds. Compact - Ideal for small apartments, basements, patios and garages. Some assembly required.
feature_bullets: Versatile and easy-to-use climber that works for all fitness levels, with BONUS companion Fitness App.
Full-body workout, combines calorie burning cardio with muscle toning in one simple step.
Low impact workout, easy on the knees and ankles.
Saves time - No need to drive to the gym and use several machines.
Easy to set up, lightweight and height adjustable. Comes 90% pre-assembled, ready to use in minutes. And compact folding for an easy storage.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
